layer.name: Sacrifice
layer.definition: Pour out for others with no expectation of return.

questions.text: I use my physical strength and capacity to help others — lifting, carrying, building, moving — even when it's tiring.
I show up bodily for people in need — I'm physically present, not just sending texts or prayers.
I do menial, unglamorous physical work to serve others — cleaning, organizing, manual labor — without needing recognition.
I give my physical energy to serve even when I'm tired — I push through fatigue to meet others' needs.
I have done physical work for others that was hard, dirty, or exhausting — and I consider it a privilege, not a burden.
